Material used.Description: The study used HEK293 cells expressing wild-type and mutant LRRK2 proteins.

Readout description.Result Description: R1441G increased kinase activity by 30% compared to wild-type.
G2019S increased kinase activity by 50% compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test was used.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Kinase activity within 10% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Kinase activity exceeding 20% of wild-type levels.

Material used.Description: Transgenic mice overexpressing LRRK2 variants were used for immunoprecipitation.

Readout description.Result Description: R1441G showed significant aggregation in brain tissue.
G2019S showed significant aggregation in brain tissue.

Biological replicates.Description: Five biological replicates from different mice were analyzed.

Technical replicates.Description: Technical replicates were not explicitly mentioned.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type mouse brain tissue was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-transgenic mouse brain tissue was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used for comparison.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No detectable aggregation in wild-type controls.
